alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Trempealeau (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 09 at 2:04AM CST until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Trempealeau River at Dodge affecting Trempealeau and Buffalo Counties. For the Trempealeau River...including Arcadia, Dodge...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Trempealeau River at Dodge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Agricultural and marsh land is flooded. At 9.5 feet, The entrance road to the Trempealeau National Wildlife Refuge is flooded. At 11.0 feet, The railroad bridge about three quarters of a mile upstream from the gage can restrict the flow. At 11.5 feet, Water covers part of County Road J in Dodge. At 12.0 feet, Low lying roads around Dodge may flood, including County Road P, as well as along a low spot on County Road J south of Dodge. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 11.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 AM CST Wednesday was 11.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 10.5 feet Tuesday evening. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 07/21/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 215 PM CST.
